Я эту игру прошел, открыл беск. режим, и открыл половину достижений.
И я готов поделится отзывом об этой игре.
Игра затягивает, но конец очень надавил на психику.
Игра сама повествует об ребенке, который одарен, и может переключить на любой канал на планете.
И особенность : Игра играбельна для дальтоников. В настройках можно выбрать режим игры, там то и есть виды дальтонизма. (Ну а если у вам Монохромный дальтонизм, то сочуствую, в этот шедевр вы не поиграете)
Что можно сказать? Игра получилась вполне добротной, и я большую ненависть испытываю к этим дурачкам в отзывах
"Мои глаза", "фу блюю", не играйте в эту игру если у вас проблемы с Животом или Зрением.
И да, в чем прикол "Шерлок"?
Спасибо за прочтение.

39275749.review:
Este juego es bastante interesante, es mas como un juego de la memoria que puede ayudarte para poder tener una mente mas rápida.
 Personalmente me ayudo a poder bajar mi estrés y eso que por lo general haría que cualquier persona se enojara por el hecho de que tienes que decir si es un color correcto con lo que esta escrito en la menor cantidad de tiempo posible, un juego que desafía tu habilidad mental en cuanto a tratar de llegar mas lejos y no equivocarte para poder llegar a los niveles mas altos en una sola sentada.
Lo malo que tengo que decir sobre este juego son las mismas advertencias que el juego te hace antes de empezar a jugar, el hecho de que sus gráficos pueden llegar a ser bastantes fuertes, tanto así que una partida muy cerca del monitor puede ocasionar dolores de cabeza o incluso epilepsia, por eso mismo recomiendo bajar bastante el brillo de sus monitores antes de empezar.
No es la gran cosa pero personalmente lo recomiendo como un relajante y como un entrenador personal psicológico para medir nuestro nivel de reacción.

39217446.review:
자신의 뇌의 한계는 어디까지일까.
반응 속도를 시험하는 듯한 게임이다.


"옳은 색이면 좌클릭, 다른 색이면 우클릭"이라는 간단한 게임방식.
하지만 플레이 내내 플레이어를 혼란시키는
시각적 함정 요소는 만만치 않다.

BGM으로 깔리는 깊은(Deep) 분위기의
전자음악이 당신의 취향에 맞다면
이 게임을 조금 더 좋아할수도 있겠다.

클리어 난이도는 매우 간단하다.
다회차 플레이로 어느 정도 포인트가 모이면
중간지점부터 시작하는 것도 가능하기 때문에
엔딩은 금방이다.

굳이 아쉬웠던 점을 꼽자면-
결국 게임 내의 스테이지의 수가
다섯 가지 정도 밖에 안된다는 점?
여덟 스테이지 이상 정도라면 어땠을까
못내 아쉬운 마음이 들었다.


결론 - 시간이 날 때 틈틈히 해보기에는
적당히 좋은 킬링타임 게임이다.
딱히 할 게임이 떠오르지 않는다면
한번쯤은 위에 있는 "게임 플레이" 버튼을 눌러보는건 어떨까.

(※공지에도 실려있으나 화려하고 자극적인 시각 효과로 인해
장애를 겪고 있는 사람이라면 발작 현상이 일 수도 있다고 하니 주의.)


P.S : 300포인트로 해금가능한 무한 모드가 있으니
한번 클리어했다면 도전해보자.

Хоть задумка игры очень проста, но сама игра выполнена на очень высоком уровне. Особено если учитывать, что игра является бесплатной. Кроме отличного дизайна, прекрасной музыки и приятного геймплея тут хорошо проработано само взаимодействие с игроком.  Игра буквально играет с вашим разумом заставляя вас раз за разом допускать ошибку. Но когда вы все таки начинаете понимать те хитрости которые применяет игра и переходите на новую локацию, то игра начинает к вам применять новые хитрости более сложные и непредсказуемые, тем самым делая геймплей более хардкорным и в то же время приятным.  
Но есть в этой игре и минусы. Для тех кто страдает эпилепсией в эту игру лучше не играть. Благо это слегка невелируется изменением настроек. 
Вообщем игра отличная и приятная, всем советую.

38890972.review:
OLDTV is, in its essence, a reflex-testing game. You stare at an old TV, reading words and clicking the left and right buttons on your mouse as fast as you can. At first the game sounds stupid. You stare at words, look at colours, and click on the right buttons. That's it. Yet you will fail in a most baffling way because you clicked way too fast for your brain to catch up.

But as you continue playing onto further levels, more and more weird mechanics start to appear. You will have to remind yourself that you need to slow down, because one wrong click can end your game instantly. I have completed the game once, but the game still manages to surprise me even after I know all its available mechanics. You will be surprised that you fail even the simplest mechanics, and you will want to try the game again and again, maybe forever or until you managed to complete the game.

The game soundtracks are also great. They are trippy and complements the aesthetics of the game. The only thing that bothers me now is why these great soundtracks are not available on Apple Music.

38769476.review:
[b]Cyan[/b] = [i]Cyan[/i]?

[b]TL;DR[/b]
All o' y'all are complaining 'bout blue and cyan. So what, am I the only idiot sittin' here mixing up purple and goddamn red? It's a philosophical nightmare, I swear -- who are you to tell me that purple ain't just a red with some more blue in it? 'Cause it is. And you can't tell me otherwise.

[h1]FULL REVIEW[/h1]
I'm just kidding. Sorta. But I'm not kidding when I say no game has made me hate myself more than this one. And I've played some detestable crap. Hell, I spent about three hours on a boss in Hyper Light Drifter and I still think this game makes me more thankful for the fact that I live just minutes away from a freeway.

Uh, helplines aside, why does it do that, you might ask? Well, if you want to get an idea for this game, it's one of those twitch-reaction things. It takes that stupid test thing with the colours and names of colours and says, "You know what we could do with this?" And some guy sitting next to Satan himself looks up. "Make a game more infuriating than Monopoly?" And that right there's the origin story. I can confirm this, I was there when they thought to make it.

Anyway, that's the core concept. As you progress the game does a few spins and tweaks to that general idea to make you even more likely to destroy your mouse in frustration. For example, you're on a roll and suddenly it screams at you, "DON'T CLICK!" Without the screaming, though. But it's still annoying as all hell, because you were on a roll, and how dare it disrespect you when you were on a ROLL.

The music is trippy enough to sooth me, though. And quite good, actually. If you like that stuff. The aesthetic is also clean and glitchy, which is enough to hide its true hatred for the average citizen. Obviously, with such a one-trick premise, it gets old pretty fast (insert title here). But it's a good enough game to come back to, every now and then, and pretty satisfying when you get into the rhythm.

Would've probably destroyed my tenth mouse if it weren't for me playing on a trackpad.

Can be accurately renamed to: CONNECTING TO GAME SERVERS FROM AUSTRALIA -- THE SIMULATION.

7/10

38762586.review:
--LENGTHY REVIEW WARNING--

So I stepped into this game thinking it was just a little game, one that you got highscores for and could check a leaderboard on.

Man, was I wrong or what? 

This game is beautifully made. With a strong use of color, a wonderful soundtrack, and addicting gameplay that had me hooked to my computer for a straight hour of...well, clicking left and right. The game SEEMS easy, but man was I wrong when I thought that.

I found myself nearly cheering after completing levels, it was a truly beautiful feeling, and the finale of the base game was much worth the long time spent playing it.

Overall? I rate this a 9/10. -1 for the Cyan, screw you Cyan! (Nah, not really though.)

36902109.review:
Because the description for this is utterly shit, let me tell you right now this is just a game based off the Stroop effect (where a word's meaning stands for a color, but the actual color of the lettering is different). I played for less than 5 minutes before I had to quit, cause it was that bad.

-horrible user menu.
-the screen effects are eyestrain hell, and I've played You Have To Win The Game.
-this is, like. the single worst gameplay idea I've ever seen.
-the tutorial doesn't even announce itself, you're just dropped in all of a sudden.
-the "yellow" is especially dark and ugly looking.
-there isn't even a quit button. you're just supposed to hold down escape.

the soundtrack was alright, but i got to hear very little of it. i will say, the colorblind modes impressed me.

文字の内容と色があっていれば左クリック、違ったら右クリックする
だけ。

のゲームなのだが、進むにつれ背景の色まで変わったり、
操作が逆さまになったりして一筋縄ではいかなくなってくる

デフォルトだと目に悪いので、
ゲームを開始したらまず設定から各種エフェクトを切ることを推奨

なにげに日本語対応。
ステージが進むと文字の並びがグチャグチャになるのだが
日本語だと「赤」「青」「紫」などほぼ一文字で出てくるので相当有利に感じた（個人差）

2秒以内の正解を連続させていくとコンボになり、画面左下に「＋」が並んでいく
「＋」が3つある時に0.6秒以内の正解を4連続成功させると5秒間無敵の連打モードに入る
これを狙って出せるようになると非常に楽しい

BGMがいい感じ、シンプルながら中毒性の高いゲーム
無料なので皆さんも今すぐハイライトの消えた目でカチカチしましょう

36375976.review:
A fun and simple yet challenging free-to-play game!
I played the free-to-play content OLDTV for about an hour before deciding to buy the recently released DLC (COLDTV). It added a nice challenge to the final stages of the game as well that I really enjoyed.
The games screen effects bothered me a little at first, but they allow you to turn most of them off in the settings.
Also, the soundtrack made the flow of the game awesome!
I ran into a small bug when attempting to unlock a certain achievement, though after mentioning it on the Steam forums the developers came by with an answer/confirmation within minutes.
If you're looking for a F2P game that is anything like OLDTV, you should definitely give it a try.

Although its pretty simple to play, it gets more challenging to play as you unlock further levels, you get less time, inverted controls and some other illusions which are trying to make you lose.

Music is very good and enjoyable, all the sound effects in the game are good. Game works very fluidly and you can feel the certain quality to it. There are alot of different visual effects too like TV bars which you can turn off if you dont like.
Since its game about colors, there are alot options for colorblind people too.

It probably wont keep you occupied for long, but its not a bad game.

- Nice music
- Simple gameplay
- Colorblind support
- Nice looking achievements
- Alot of options
- You can buy some boosts with currency you earn with achievements

Cons:
- Losing screen turn off can be a bit annoying

[h1] OLDTV é definitivamente um dos jogos mais viciantes da Steam, e ainda é de graça! [/h1]
Se você não gostou do jogo, seu QI provavelmente não é alto o suficiente, entããão... Você deveria começar a assistir um pouco de Rick & Morty.
Deixando isso de lado, OLDTV é um jogo misterioso. O final com a criança chorando me deixou um pouco chocado na primeira vez, admito (cadê a mãe dessa criança bicho).
A mecânica do jogo é muito simples, você deve apertar o botão esquerdo do mouse M1 caso a cor condiza com a palavra, e o botão direito caso não. A simplicidade do jogo é o que o torna ainda mais viciante, pois você fica à mercê apenas de seus reflexos e raciocínio rápido. Isso torna o jogo um tanto quanto frustrante, pois caso você erre a sequência, a culpa é apenas SUA (pra completar o jogo sem pular nenhuma área são uns 250 canais).
Então prepare-se, pois você vai se frustrar de uma forma inimaginável!
[h1] Principalmente quando você confundir Azul com Ciano.
Sério.
Você vai confundir.
Várias vezes.
E vai se sentir um idiota em cada uma delas.

Nota: 10/10

35804270.review:
Never before has a game required such intense concentration while also forcing you to turn your brain off entirely.

I only have two real complaints with this game;
[list]
[*]No option to turn off sound effects without muting the game entirely. Maybe it's just me, but while I like the soundtrack, the sound effects can be really annoying and distracting (although that might be the point), [b]especially[/b] that weird glitchy-sounding noise that seems to play at complete random. I think it has something to do with the various numbers flying around the screen while you play, but it's hard to pay attention to those while the 4th of July is going on inside your head, except with blood vessels exploding instead of fireworks.
[*]Too much time between failing and restarting. Yes, it's only like two or three seconds, but a game like this where you screw up about 40 times a second needs as little downtime as possible between attempts, so you don't have time to realize that what you're doing is really frustrating and difficult and you should probably stop before blood starts coming out of your ears in addition to your nose and eyes.
[/list]
Overall though, it's a simplistic and mildly entertaining time-waster that might have been better suited as a mobile game or something, but it serves its purpose pretty well regardless. Probably not something I'll play extensively, but giving it a good review because it's a decent concept and not really what I'd call a "bad" game.


Also, I'm not having the trouble with cyan that everyone keeps complaining about. Instead I keep messing up with blue and purple, which probably means that either my monitor is fucked up, or my eyes are.
I hope it's not my monitor, because those are expensive.

35583053.review:
[h1]You got mail![/h1]

How to differentiate a bad Free to Play singleplayer game from a good one? Well, a good one definitely was made to be enjoyable and it also doesn't have this hogwash microtransactions. Furthermore, it's even better if this kind of game is rewarding and gives players a reason to play it again. OLDTV fits in this image of a perfect free game very well. In my opinion it's one of the best indie games in a zero-budget class that are available on Steam.


[h1]Heroes = couch potatoes[/h1]

In this game you become a guy sitting in front of TV and surfing through different channels. Doesn't sound very interesting, does it? Definitely not, but a simple mechanic made this process entertaining and somewhat challenging. When you start a game, on your screen appears a word indicating a color (e.g. Green, Cyan, Red). If a color of a given word is the same as a word idicates you have to click your left mouse button, if it's different – right button. Simple. Simple yet diverse, because when you get to the next levels it becomes harder. Game starts to flip your screen upside down, makes your controls inverted or creates different screen distortions that disturb you while you're trying to identify if it's a right color or not. "Campaign" is divide into few levels (so called continents) which get increasingly harder, introducing you to new mechanics. You can also unlock an endless mode, but I won't tell you how to do that. It's a secret.[spoiler]press space bar in the main menu[/spoiler]

On a technical, side this game looks pretty cool. The menu as well as the rest of the game itself it's stylized to look like an old TV. Sounds are well matched and music gives you this special vibe which is hard to compare with something else. When it comes to rewarding players it has several dozen achievments that give you in-game bonuses and while unlocking them in a game menu they give you a special sound effect which is related to this achievment or something from a real world. Some references are droll, like for example Trump's speech.


[h1]Shut up and take my mo... my free time![/h1]

For a Free to Play game OLDTV it's a very well made product, it has potential for mastering your reflexes and getting all of the achievments is satisfying (I will definitely try to 100% this piece). Probably the biggest flaw of this game is a fact that it can cause an epilepsy, it's quite flashy and jumpy. If it's not a problem for you, then you should definitely try it. It's free, the only thing that you will pay are few minutes of your time, if you won't like it, you can always uninstall.


[h1]Don't let mom know[/h1]

35168935.review:
This game is so simple, yet I love it! You need to choose whether or not the color and the word matches, that's it. There's nothing much else to that.

The thing that really makes it stand out is HOW it's all done. The retro tube TV effect gives back a nostalgic or a back-in-the-old-days feel. The vision from the screen itself will play tricks on you, whether that be flashing the screen or altering the words, and much more. Also, I absolutely love the soundtrack. It's catchy and pleasing to listen to.

I wish I were able to play more of this game, but my computer isn't able to run it very well without it crashing and by turning down the graphic features I feel would dilute the challenge it poses as well as the overview of the game itself.

To top it all off, it's free-to-play. Do give this game a try!

35166434.review:
For a game whos premise is all about flipping TV channels with the power of a childs mind, this has got to be one of the most visually engrossing time killers ive played, its a simplistic concept of "match the colors to the words"...but its not that simple, this game absolutely loves to play tricks on your mind by changing the background color, flipping the screen upside down, and changing up the controls on you at a moments notice, it may sound frustrating, but in reality its much more enjoyable and relaxing. 
In summary: "A Relaxing Rubiks Cube" is how id describe this brilliant game, fair, but very challenging. Enjoy.

Typing mode is broken af, you can grind so many channel points through it, you can end up holding-to-skip the entire game after a couple dozen runs.

Definitely one of the best free, and besides that, best reflex games I've ever played.

P.S. Cyan is my new least/most favorite color.

9/10, would flip through Saturn again.

P.P.S. To the dev, I found your cats' picture in the Assets you scrub.

34853791.review:
[h1]What a Remarkable Experience: A Review of OLDTV[/h1]

[i]OLDTV[/i] (also sometimes referred to as [i]V[/i]) is a free-to-play indie game developed and published by Creability. The game consists of the player switching through different "channels," which are all accessable within 5 different "regions." Each region has different channels that present different gameplay mechanics. The main mechanic in the game is the method in which the user must switch between the channels. If the text displayed onscreen matches the color of which it is describing, the user must left-click to go to the next channel. If the text does not match the color of which it is describing, the user must right-click to go to the next channel, all of which must be done in rapid succession throughout the game. If the user makes one mistake, it is game over, as the game does not contain a stock/life system. The game is more of a test in how fast the user can process and react to information being rapidly thrown at them, but ultimately mastered in a clever and artistic and creative fashion, which results in an astounding gameplay experience.

[h1]Pro's and Con's of OLDTV[/h1]

[b]Pro's[/b]
+ Well-designed interface
+ Easy to learn, hard to master
+ No ultimately steep learning curve, jump in and play
+ Free-to-play
+ No in-game microtransactions - the full experience is there from the get-go
+ Achievements that take effort to earn
+ Amazing artstyle and aesthetic feel
+ Smooth, quick, responsive gameplay
+ Addition of new mechanics mid-game work very smoothly, and take little to no time to understand fully
+ Fantastic soundtrack with music from multiple artists, fits the feel of the gameplay and the artstyle

[b]Con's[/b]
- Replayability after unlocking all achievements and completing the game fully is lacking

[h1]Conclusion of My Review of OLDTV[/h1]

[b]Overall Score:[/b] 10/10
[b]Would I recommend this game?:[/b] Yes.
[b]Other Statements:[/b] A masterfully crafted experience, definitely one worth downloading and giving a try. I am genuinely surprised that OLDTV does not have a price tag on it. Wonderful job, Creability.

[h1]V the fast paced nerve wrecking experience[/h1]

[b]Gameplay[/b]

V tests your reflexes and mindset in so many different ways Gameplay is simple, you are given a word in a certain color, and if the word matches its color you left click, if this is not the case, you left click. Surprisingly this very basic concept is amazingly addicting, with every level getting even tougher with the addition of randomized events that break your mindset and concentration. All of this merged with an amazing aesthetic soundtrack

[i]Pros[/i]
[list]
[*]Free
[*]endless gameplay
[*]invites you to be curious and to take the game seriously
[*]Rewarding
[*]amazing aesthetic music
[/list]

[i]Cons[/i]
[list]
[*]No records / high scores
[/list]
[b]TL;DR[/b]
Solid and rewarding game that invites you to concentrate and to take it seriously with an amazing soundtrack to back it all up.

[spoiler]9/10 what V brings to the table as a re-used format is outstandingly good and has defenetly earned a space in your steam library [/spoiler]

34796790.review:
[h1][b]El color del título de esta review es verde[/b][/h1]

[b]O al menos eso es lo que diría el juego para provocar un conflicto interno entre nuestros impulsos mentales y nuestra función de relación... Pero sí, básicamente, ese es el concepto del juego.[/b]

¿Recordáis aquella prueba de Brain Training que se trataba de denominarle a un color un nombre con el que nuestro cerebro no relacione con la apariencia del mismo? Pues aquí se sigue una línea continuista del mismo. 

 La diferencia de este título respecto a la prueba anteriormente mencionada es que el mismo crea un ecosistema propio, con una estética depurada y una implementación de mecánicas que harán que nuestro cerebro se coagule de una forma más severa. También cuenta con una banda sonora, la cual acompaña realmente bien a los diferentes continentes por los que vamos avanzando. 

Para jugar, haremos uso de nuestro click izquierdo para corroborar que la relación entre color y palabra es correcta y click derecho para rechazar la opción que nos propone el juego. Simple pero efectivo.

Mención especial a los logros del título, ya que ofrecen retos interesantes a superar y exprimirán aún más el potencial del juego.

Como cómputo global, este juego hace uso de pocos recursos, pero se aprovechan de una forma tan satisfactoria que dan como resultado un juego divertidísimo y ameno. Un buen ejemplo de lo que los juegos gratis deberían de ser.

Ah, se me olvidaba; ya distingo a la perfección la diferencia entre azul y cian

34707767.review:
OLDTV est un jeu simplissime, au concept déjà largement connu. Alors, pourquoi ça marche? Tout simplement car c'est simple, épuré, stimulant, avec une musique excellente à mon goût, et un gameplay prenant.

Le principe? Si la couleur et le texte correspondent : clic gauche. Sinon : clic droit. Simple, non? HAHAHA. Attendez vous de voir à quel point le cyan et le violet sont traitres. Et on est en plus sur un jeu du type une erreur = terminé.

Voici un bon conseil : pour éviter d'avoir des maux de têtes (et rendre le jeu plus agréable) désactivez l'option Ecran de télé dans les options.

Le jeu est entièrement traduit en français, mais vous pouvez aussi l'essayer en anglais, ce qui pourrait être plus simple vu que les noms de couleurs sont plus longs en français qu'en anglais.

Enfin bref, OLDTV est rapide, et vas bien vous stimuler comme il faut. Il n'est pas forcément long et peut être terminé en 1h si vous êtes chaud. Mais une fois terminé, il vaut mieux s'accrocher pour récupérer tous les achievements...

OLDTV est entièrement gratuit et je vous recommande très fortement d'y jouer!

О этот геймплэй! Господи! Божественно! Кликать мышкой! Кто до этого догадался?

Ну, а вообще игра затягивает и, пусть она простая, короткая и быстрая, оставляет приятное впечатление и желание ненавидеть себя, свою мышку и всё вокруг. Насчёт оригинальности достижений - такая себе оригинальность. Куча других игр имеют куда больше и куда более оригинальные достижения, здесь же 60%-70% достижений достигаются благодаря простому прохождению игры без заморочек. Если накопить достаточное количество ЦП (Да, неплохо, кстати), то можно просто пролистать всю игру при помощи пролистывающего апгрейда и наблюдать за тем, как вам сыпятся ачивменты. 

Вывод: хорошая игра, особенно, чтобы убить немного времени, прекрасно заставляет перестать думать и болеть ваши глаза, надеюсь, что будет добавлено в будущем несколько новых приколов каналов, а то на Африке разочаровало отсутствие новых техник (Хотя возможно мне просто ну ооочень повезло и я таковых не встретил).

34453318.review:
Un juego maravilloso en un [b]simpleza[/b] que pone a prueba tus [b]reflejos y velocidad mental[/b]. 

Y cuando digo simpleza lo digo en serio. La cosa es así: si el nombre del color que te aparece en pantalla está escrito en su color, tenés que apretar clic izquierdo; si está escrito con otro color, clic derecho. Parece fácil, pero cuando lo hacés rápido, te sorprende lo difícil que se pone. Después para colmo las cosas se van complicando, cambiando, y hay más de una sorpresa. Así que tampoco te podés descuidar ni confiar en que ya le tomaste la mano. 

Los gráficos también son super simples, pero excelentes. 
Con una estética [b]retro[/b] muy bien pensada, encantadora, y configurable. 
Mientras que los requisitos de hardware son casi nulos.

Y aunque no lo parezca a simple vista, es un muy buen juego. 
[strike]Frustrantemente[/strike] [b]adictivo[/b]. 
Te hace pensar en lo abandonada que tenías esa parte del cerebro.

Ah, y encima es [b]gratis[/b]!

Así que no dejes de probarlo!

34384013.review:
Luego de terminar el juego, puedo decír que es muy entretenido para mi gusto. Su simplicidad de funciones y el arte gráfico basado en televisores noventosos acompañado de una banda sonora crea un juego genial y sencillo. Al principio uno no entiende de que trata el juego, pero cuando uno logra entenderlo no para de jugar hasta terminarlo.


[b]De qué trata el juego[/b].
El juego trata acerca de una persona que se va conectando a cada país del mundo a través de canales de televisión (es algo raro, ya que hay un solo canal por país). No se entiende exactamente cual es el motivo por el cual se quiere llegar a eso.


[b]Cómo se juega[/b].
Uno tiene que prestar atención a la palababra que le aparece en el medio de pantalla, para dar un ejemplo cualquiera: [b]Rojo[/b]. Si ese color está pintado de el mismo color que indica la palabra, hay que apretar click izquierdo. Si esa palabra no es del color que indica, hay que apretar el click derecho.

Ejemplos:
-[b]Amarillo[/b] pintado de amarillo - Click izquierdo.
-[b]Verde[/b] pintado de azúl (u otro color que no sea verde) - Click derecho.


Para finalizar, un [b]Punteo General del juego[/b]

[b]Gráficos[/b]: 10/10. Muy originales para mi gusto.

[b]Banda Sonora[/b]: 8/10. Puede no ser del gusto de las personas.

[b]Historia: 2/10[/b]. Prácticamente no tiene historia, ya que solo aparecen un par de textos al principio del juego.

[b]Largo del juego[/b]: 5/10. Podría ser mucho mejor, ([spoiler]aunque al final se desbloquea un Modo Infinito[/spoiler]).

[b]Logros[/b]: 9/10. Los mismos están muy bien pensados para ambientar el juego y para hacerlo durar mucho a través de logros difíciles de obtener.

34324523.review:
Игра про переключение каналов на старом телеке из 90x
Основной задачей игры является определение соответствия: название цвета и его цвет
Если на экране написано желтый но красным цветом то жмете - ПКМ
Если желтый желтым цветом то - ЛКМ
Суть игры кликать так пока не переключитесь на другой канал и собирать очки чтобы качать навыки и открывать каналы
Но в процесе все будет усложнятся переврнутыми словами и сменой назначения кнопок мыши
И поиграть долго вряд-ли получится потому что глаза начинают болеть из за частого милькания
Вообщем советую этот очень хорошый киллер времени
Надеюсь разраб выпустит эту игру на телефоны

34322535.review:
我只玩了20分钟，但我保证我一定不会再去碰他，（我本人的情况下）。
此款游戏简而言之[spoiler]  就是判断颜色和文中所描述的意思是否相同，是的话点鼠标左键，反之点右键。 [/spoiler]
过于枯燥的点击，虽说有时会出来“反向控制”这种操作，但是这避免不了所蕴含的单调性。
虽说这个是好评原声音乐的游戏，但是你真的去体验游戏内容的时候反而不会太去注意这个游戏的BGM。你只有一秒左右的考虑时间来选择你的左或右。如此紧的时间来逼迫着你，怎么去细细的听游戏原声呢？
当你连接频道的时候，嘈杂的电视雪花声音再听过几次后就难以入耳，如果想跳过开头还要在游戏中购买。

34281580.review:
A simple game where you just left click if the color matches the word or right click if it doesn't.

[b]Simple Yet addictive[/b]
It is simple yet addictive as the game lets you retry it really quickly whenever you fail and what's really captivating are the soundtracks used in the multiple "Levels" or countries. These soundtracks really fit the game and the kind of gameplay it has as the soundtracks have a certain beat or tune to it that fits how you just click and click your way through the channels. If anything this is a free game and it already offered me almost an hour of entertainment.

[b]Tons of things to find out[/b]
Even if you finish the game, the game still has some secrets for you to find out for yourself if you're completionist so I definitely recommend this game to anyone to try out but beware if you aren't used to or can't stand flashng colors.

34265898.review:
For the most part I enjoyed this game, but there are some big issues with clarity that I'm not a fan of. Perhaps all of these problems are only on the Mac version (which I have), or simply due to me being stupid, and if so, my apologies.


1. Some commands, in particular 'inverted controls' appear about a half second after the colour has appeared, meaning I often click the correct answer before the game has confirmed what I shouldn't do.

2. The tutorial ought to be a little longer. I presume 'inverted controls' means click the opposite button to the correct answer, but that seems to cause me to lose the game too, so I've ended up holding down the mouse button to skip the inverted controls parts. I don't understand why the game doesn't take you aside when you fail these sections and teach you how to progress- perhaps extend the tutorial as you unlock continents?


3. Again, issues with clarity. When buying a new continent for example, I eventually had to Google search what to do, since when buying other skills you just clip on the skill, but buying a continent requires clicking on the continent and then the price of the continent. The game seems to make the most basic things very counterintuitive- why not just have a 'click to buy' button or something?

Overall it's a very well polished game and the mechanics and ways it tries to trick you are very clever, but in a skill-based game that relies on player speed the player should never fail because they were cheated, e.g. the game displayed information after the player had made a decision, or because the player was unaware of what was required to progress.

34251150.review:
OLDTV muestra un juego en el que directamente pone a prueba nuestras habilidades de reacción, sabiendo que las reglas son básicas, el juego puede llegar a ser dificil, pero no imposible, como jugador me ha parecido muy bueno el titulo a tal grado de aportar un dolar sobre este proyecto,

¿Que lo hace especial?
hay varias cosas que lo hacen especial como las siguientes:

Jugabilidad
Esto como más importante, el juego tiene sus reglas simples, el color tiene que coincidir con su propio nombre, e incluso la difilcutad sube conforme vayas cambiando de nivel, equivocarte a proposito, no tocar nada, reconectarte, la palabra de cabeza, el orden de las letras distorcionado y el cambio de color en el fondo, proporcionando mayor difilcutad al jugador, aunque esto es facil de dominar si llevas la practica, no habria nada de quitar, pues el juego te plantea algo justo, tratar de realizar los cambios de canales de manera rapida y correcta.

Aspecto
el aspecto viene en tematica de televisiones estandar, lo hace muy fiel a como son las televisiones anteriores a los de la actualidad, tiene efectos unicos, algo que puedo recomendar es que para que se vea como dichas televisiones, coloca una resolución que deje la pantalla cuadrada, pues asi puedes lograr una vista más fiel

Jugabilidad
esto lo hace muy bueno, tiene reglas muy básicas, pero al tratarse de una reacción rapida y correcta esto puede ser facil o dificil, incluso frustrante, pero no como para odiar el juego, ya que con los aspectos audiovisuales que tiene simplemente es dificil odiar el juego

Soundtrack y efectos de sonido
La banda sonora es simplemente hermosa, incluso al realizar combos que hacen un cambio en cuanto a la aceleración y aumento de tono de las canciones que van por nivel, sigue sonando bien e incluso sonando mejor, los efectos de sonido son muy comodos

Buenas referencias
El juego cuenta con varias referencias, desde los viejos sonidos al realizar conexion en internet en los 90's hasta la campaña presidencial de Donald Trump, tambien cuentan con algunos chistes en los logros, tomando en cuenta que el juego realiza ciertas bromas al jugador al ver de estos logros y algunas otras referencias en medio del juego

El juego desde mi punto de vista no tiene nada de malo, es muy bueno

34219098.review:
[i]OLDTV[/i] is a game that utilizes a well-known mind quirk: if you write the name of a color (like 'Red') in a different color (like blue), we become all confused, unable to quickly tell which color the font is and which, the semantics. In this game, however, you'll have to do precisely that, quickly judging color names written in various colors as they flash at you on the screen. This is more or less it, save for various additional challenges like words being written upside-down and so on.

You can actually finish the game in half an hour if you're a fast learner, but it also has a bunch of achievements that probably require honing your skills for a while. And it does as every point feel fair. Nothing in the game wastes your time, it's just a straightforward challenge through and through.

A good example of what free games should be.

34178299.review:
What do you get when you take a simple colour test, add in some distracting mechanics, multiply it with some adrenaline-fuelled pumping music and use an everyday household that's been around for years? You get OLDTV.

While the gameplay is super simple and easy to learn by left-clicking if the colour's matching the word, and right-clicking if it doesn't match the word, you may think that it's going to be easy, but it isn't. As you're faced with a decreasing Frequency counter (timer) and a large variety of distracting mechanics, you'll need to think as fast as you can without making a mistake as one wrong move will just simply end your TVenture. Can you quickly find the signal, or perhaps can you figure out the answer if the word is upside down, jumbled up whilst the screen's in a different colour and your controls has been inverted?

It's a really fun game with an endless plethora of channels to flick through, as if you're actually watching some TV yourself! I do recommend it if you're interested in a simple, but challenging and intense, game.

TV 화면의 글자와 색에 반응하자.

노이즈 생기고, 좌우나 상하가 바뀌는 이상한 TV화면에 글자가 나타납니다.
RED, YELLOW, GREEN, BLUE, CYAN, PURPLE의 6가지 글자가 색을 가지고 등장하며,
이 글자의 뜻과 색상이 동일하면 마우스 좌클릭/ 틀리면 우클릭을 합니다.

그에 따라 콤보가 쌓이면서 CP를 얻고, 제한된 시간 이내에 목표로 하는 횟수를 맞추면 클리어!
아시아, 유럽 등의 다른 지역으로 넘어가서 다시 해당 플레이를 진행합니다.
만약 클릭을 잘못하면 그대로 종료!!!

가는 선, 마구잡이 지직거림 등의 노이즈가 발생하거나,
좌우 또는 상하로 화면이 반전되어 순간적인 멈칫거림을 유도합니다.
또는 마우스 좌우 클릭이 반대로 설정되는 경우도 있죠.
마지막 순간까지 긴장을 놓을 수 없는 게임.

아쉬운 점
-CP를 이용한 스킬의 효과를 느끼기 힘듬
-CP획득 조건을 잘 모르겠음

Klasický test ve kterém máte říct jakou barvu má text slova a plete vás fakt, že nápis samotný bývá název barvy jiné. Jen místo říkání klikáte a plete se vám do toho hudba, deformace obrazu či protočení ovládání. A s něčím, čemu by se dalo s velkoryse přimhouřeným okem říkat backstory, aneb důvod proč to vlastně všechno děláte.

Hra ze začátku může vypadat zajímavě, soundtrack není špatný a vizuálně to také není žádná pohroma. Body k dobru za to, že je zahrnuto i víc jazyků než jen angličtina (čeština samozřejmě noc included, ale což). OLDTV se však brzo omrzí a ve výsledku je z toho stále jen další zábava jen na pár minut a nic víc. Menu které nemá daleko od nepřehlednosti tomu moc nepomáhá.

5/10, iz free, was okay.

34019894.review:
[h1]Tak łatwo oszukać umysł - [i]OLDTV[/i][/h1]


Bardzo prosta, bynajmniej niegłupia, gra z kategorii Free to Play dość szybko podbiła moje serce. Polega ona na przełączaniu kanałów telewizyjnych ze wszystkich kontynentów (nie licząc Antarktydy, pingwiny nie posiadają własnej telewizji, niestety). Jeden kanał = jeden napis = jeden kolor. Aby przejść dalej, należy stwierdzić, czy np. słowo "czerwony" zostało zapisane czerwonymi literami. Jeśli tak, trzeba nacisnąć LPM. Jeśli napis, mimo wskazywania na czerwony, jest cyjanowy, fioletowy, niebieski, zielony lub żółty, trzeba nacisnąć PPM. Gracz otrzymuje miks nazw opisujących kolor, poprawnych bądź błędnych, a klikać musi szybko, bo częstotliwość stale spada. Ta podróż po krajach jest czasami urozmaicana dodatkowymi zadaniami. Pierwsze zabrania klikania, a w drugim przyciski (LPM - prawidłowy, PPM - nieprawidłowy) zostają zamienione. Wyzwania te wymagają precyzji, zwłaszcza że łatwo je przeoczyć, poza tym w szale klikania pomyłka (na jakimś etapie) jest nieuchronna.

To, co widać w grze, to ekran starego telewizora z charakterystycznymi uwypukleniami po bokach. Zdarzają się gęste szumy i nagłe zmiany barwy całego tła, przez co gorzej widać napis, a co za tym idzie, ciężej rozpoznać, czy kolor jest właściwie do niego dopasowany.

Inspiracją do stworzenia OLDTV był efekt Stroopa. Jest to demonstracja czasu reakcji na zadanie, a ponieważ na Wikipedii hasło wyjaśniono w sposób bardzo zrozumiały, pozwolę sobie przytoczyć fragment tego krótkiego artykułu: [i]"Przykładem jest określanie koloru tekstu. Gdy kolor tekstu i tekst nie są zgodne (np. słowo "zielony" wydrukowane niebieską czcionką, lub "czerwony" wydrukowane na zielono), człowiek poproszony o określenie koloru tekstu zrobi to wolniej i z większym prawdopodobieństwem błędu, niż gdyby tekst i jego kolor były zgodne (np. słowo "żółty" wydrukowane żółtą czcionką)"[/i]. Można, jak widać, przenieść zagadnienie czysto psychologiczne do świata gier.

OLDTV ma dużo zalet. Rozgrywka jest możliwa w języku polskim i wciąga, ale nie da się w niej zatracić na kilka godzin z rzędu, co osobiście uważam za atut, zwłaszcza że zdarza mi się grać między różnymi obowiązkami. Oprawa muzyczna jest przyjemna dla ucha, a całokształt gry prosty, ale nie ubogi. W jednej z zakładek w menu głównym za punkty zdobyte w czasie tury można wykupywać różne przedmioty, jak np. drugą szansę w przypadku popełnienia błędu. Na minus ocenię na pewno to, że po około pół godzinie grania bolą oczy, a ogłupiony mózg nie wyrabia w dopasowywaniu koloru do napisu, dlatego popełnia się więcej błędów (nawet na początku tury, a więc wtedy, kiedy jest najłatwiej). Oczywiście nie wynika to z błędu popełnionego przez twórców, którzy musieli świadomie podjąć decyzję o telewizyjnej stylistyce, szumach i drażniącym po dłuższym czasie manipulowaniu tłem. Mimo to stwierdzam, że chociażby 20 minut rozgrywki stanowi dla umysłu dobre ćwiczenie refleksu i szybkiego myślenia.

Jeśli jesteście zaintrygowani, nie zwlekajcie i pobierzcie OLDTV. Zajmie to kilka minut. A, no i do zdobycia są 32 ukryte osiągnięcia (chociaż w grze da się sprawdzić, co trzeba zrobić, aby je odblokować), zatem powodzenia!

PS Nie dla daltonistów i epileptyków.

34014583.review:
OLDTV has a simple concept. You click the colour with the corresponding word. Sounds really simple right? Well, as you play along, the game gets more difficult the longer you last. Such as the wrong colour with the wrong word or with scrambled letters, not clicking any buttons and so on. It's a very well executed game that got me addicted immediately despite not playing it for an hour!  It's soundtrack is very good and it gives its stage a personality to show itself.  [b] If you are affected by seizures or anything similar of it, I wouldn't play it at your discretion! [/b]
Fortunately for colourblind people (which I'm not one of those), there is an option for colourblindness in multiple coloured filters, making it a bit easier. Overall, it's a simple, fun and frustrating game that doesn't use up a lot of space!

[h1] Pros [/h1]
-Very simple gameplay
-Frustrating but fun challenges as it gets harder
-Awesome Soundtrack
-Great Visuals

[h1] Cons [/h1]
-People with seizures may not enjoy this game
-People with colourblindness may have difficulty to play even with colourblind settings

[h1] Rating: [/h1] 9.5/10

33993791.review:
Endermoon的评测世界。
类型：视觉类游戏
推荐：是
评测分数：64
一、通用(45/60)
画面(9/10)：线条勾画所构成的美与颜色结合起来简直太棒了。
质量（开发用心度）(8/10)：相当不错，可以看出也是用了很大心血。
吸引度(7/10)：初玩的时候会觉得挺不错：“还有这种操作？！”。
创新度(8/10)：虽然这种视觉类游戏已经存在了相当长时间，可是尝试这种方法的游戏还是少之又少；这个创新不错。
操作性(6/10)：容易上手，后期的要求也并不是很难达到。
可玩度(5/10)：后期容易疲惫，抗枯燥性较差。没有什么重要亮点。
二、附加分(21)
语言支持(-2)：支持迷一样的简体中文：部分翻译有误，如“败给青色的时间”中“时间”明显是表达“次数”之意的times；后期的关卡的附加条件中文根本看不懂；有些地方是繁体。
视觉效果(-3)：线条的勾画还是不错的，可是颜色处理实在对眼睛不大好，玩久了容易酸痛，所以是一个失分点。
人性化(10)：照顾部分色弱的……视觉类游戏。
剧情(-2)：这个无厘头剧情不如没有。
成就(5)：蛮有挑战性的系统。
独立游戏(10)独立游戏自带加分项。
价格(3)：这款游戏在我看来值得10-20元；实际价格为0元。因此额外加分(15(10和20的平均值)-0)/3
三、总而言之
总而言之还是推荐的。但是不要持续玩太久，否则眼睛会不适。
四、后话
我的评测标准就是通用的60分和一些附加分。只有大于等于60分的游戏我才会推荐。
通用分每项满分为10，最低为1。
附加分每项最高与最低打分为正负30。价格以非折扣价格为准。当折扣超过30天的时候会放弃对此项的评分；当超过90天的时候会以折扣价格为准。

没看到自己语言的评测，在此留一篇简评给点进来的玩家。
这是一款简单的颜色识别和反应训练游戏，色盲患者慎入。
字体以不同颜色呈现出来，符合点Yes错误点No，容错率零，失误重来。(Yes是左键，No是右键。)
游戏设定大概是一个天赋异禀的孩子观看全世界的电视。别问我这是什么坑爹设定，我也不知道...可能只是给以各大洲和区域命名的关卡一个合理解释吧_(:зゝ∠)_
从主观角度来讲还是比较推荐的，毕竟也是免费游戏，感兴趣的玩家可以喜加一。但是从客观来看，画面(尤其是关卡内的画面)模糊不清，应该是游戏方刻意制作成这样的风格，但我玩下来只怀疑自己是不是得了白内障。辨识的时候极其费眼，希望以后能有所改善吧。

33976679.review:
In OLDTV bekommt man Namen von Farben angezeigt, die selbst eine bestimmte Schriftfarbe haben. Durch Rechts- oder Linksklick muss man sich entscheiden, ob die Schriftfarbe zu dem angezeigten Farbnamen passt oder nicht. Beispielsweise erscheint in grüner Schriftfarbe das Wort "Grün" - das wäre korrekt. Das Wort "Rot" in blauer Schriftfarbe wäre falsch. Im Grunde genommen ist das auch schon das ganze Spielprinzip. 

Was sich zunächst einfach anhört, kann jedoch auch ganz schön kompliziert werden, denn das Spiel versucht einen häufiger auch aufs Glatteis zu führen: so kann z. B. zusätzlich die Hintergrundfarbe wechseln oder der Name der Farbe steht auf dem Kopf. Und dann ist es gar nicht so einfach in kürzester Zeit zu entscheiden, ob da in blauer Schrift nun "Lila" oder "Blau" auf dem Kopf steht und ob die Schriftfarbe passt, während der Hintergrund türkis ist. Zusätzlich kommen dann noch so lustige Aktionen hinzu, wie z. B. "nicht klicken" oder - ganz fies - "andersrum klicken". Dann muss man genau das Gegenteil davon klicken, was richtig wäre. Als Ausgleich gibt es jedoch auch positive Effekte, die man für erspielte CP aktivieren kann, wie z. B. Überspringen, 2. Chance usw.

Mir gefällt das Spiel ganz gut, es ist halt einfach mal was Kurzweiliges für zwischendurch. Vielleicht nicht unbedingt um den Kopf frei zu kriegen, da man sich durchaus konzentrieren muss - aber Spaß macht es trotzdem. Die Motivation liegt vor allem darin, dass man immer weiter kommen möchte.

Das Spiel ist kostenlos, man kann aber - auf freiwilliger Basis - den Entwicklern etwas zukommen lassen (siehe Shopseite bei Steam). Tut man es nicht, hat man keinerlei Einschränkungen im Spiel.

33973416.review:
OLDTV is a fun and eye straining game that incorporates colors and matching them with the correct name. It's a great brain-power game but it's short since I completed the game in fourty or so mins. Though, I could see myself replaying the game, which is a plus.

The only downside to this game is that my eyes were killing me when playing. I could only play the game for five mins and then I would have to take a break. The game does have a warning before playing but I would have liked if they kept the effects to a minimum.

Otherwise, OLDTV is a good game to play if you're bored or looking to challenge your brain!

Das hier ist genau das. Bloß macht man Linksklick wenn Farbe und Wort übereinstimmen und Rechtsklick wenn es nicht stimmt. Das wird in einem Retrolook verpackt darum bekommt es die Wertung:
EINFACH-GENIAL

Es trainiert Gedächtnis, spornt zur Highscorejagd an und unterhält irgendwie. Ich weiß nicht wie. Ich liebe es <3

33956617.review:
OLDTV is a 90s themed retro explosion. The game is essentially a binary [url=http://iws2.collin.edu/lipscomb/16_week_course/stroop_lab.htm]Stroop test[/url] with some added twists and a pumping soundtrack. The soundtrack itself is exciting as you think from second to second for every question. Albeit a little short, this is a neat doodad with the special price of being free!

Highly recommended if you are into the glitch art/vaporwave-esque art style.

33956231.review: I keep on trying to go further and further just to listen to the music, it's amazing, the soundtrack should be sold on it's own, or given as a donation perk

33955837.review:
Итак, так как я ленивая задница, то обзор будет коротким и не будет в себе нести смысловой нагрузки.
Редко в бесплатных играх увидишь вроде простую и примитивную игру, но и в тоже время реально увлекательную что я видел. Мне это напомнило март месяц, была пара по тренингу и было такое же задание, Там нужно было только перечислить цвета, при этом стараясь не читать. Но в итоге многие просто сбивплись из-за слов. Благо пришлось пойти на хитрость и перевернуть листок. Тем самым можно было перечислить цвета. Тут слегка иначе, потому что нужно обращать внимание и на цвет и на текст, а иначе ты пррсто проиграешь голубому. Радует то, что тут многие факторы влияют на психологическую составляющую человека: мышление, реакция и прочее. Эти звуки словно врубил Atari 2600... Тут даже музыка динамичная дабы ты не спал, а реально напряг свое внимание и у этой игры это чертовски выходит. Всем советую поиграть, кроме тех кто чаще бомбит и эпилептиков. Ибо из-за цветовой передачи может произойти эпилепсия и это добром не сулит. Даже игра об этом предупреждает.

Игра порадовала. Отлично подойдет позалипать, если обдолбался или бахнул пару литров пивченского. Такой не типичный таймкиллер-кликер. Если кому хочется посмотреть на геймплей, вот видео обзор (не сочтите за рекламу): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lrP-rqBXhwI&t=523s
+Оформление в стиле VHS - симулятор эпилептика. (После Кунг Фьюри мода видать пошла на подобные вещи)
+Есть ачивки, и довольно таки интересные.
+Узнаешь такой новый для себя цвет, как ЦИАН. (ГРЕБАННЫЙ ЦИАН, ДА КАК ТАК ТО)
+Музыкальное сопровождение в принципе приятное
-После длительного залипания мозг начинает плавиться
-Нельзя сделать потише, только вкл/выкл звук
-Если долго играть, один глаз начинает посылать другой на все четыре стороны
Минусы в игре не значительные, но они есть.

33928562.review:
[h1]Не думайте об этом[/h1]

Наверняка сто раз видели, слово "синий" написано красным, или что-то подобное, создающее противоречие. Так вот, сие явление называется эффектом Струпа. А если подробнее и понятнее, то смотря на слово, мы на автомате читаем его, и, когда нас просят назвать цвет, первым в голову приходит именно прочитанный, а вовсе не фактический. В этом и заключается эффект Струпа, а на данном эффекте в свою очередь и построен сам тест. 
Точно известно, что за распознавание цветов и за чтение отвечают разные доли мозга, но почему из двух вариантов выбирается прочитанный – здесь мнения специалистов расходятся. Существует теория, связанная с экономией ресурсов - видя слово на знакомом языке, мы автоматически его читаем, поэтому в голове появляется некий готовый ответ. Вот и весь принцип.

Перейдем к самой игре. Приятно, что она бесплатна, и внутренний Мойша вновь радуется. Интересная стилизация под старый телевизор бати, звук также на высоте, играть просто комфортно. Имеются уровни, а точнее континенты, которые разблокируются по мере игры.
Игровой процесс сам по себе уже достаточно сложен, но..."почему бы не сделать сложнее?" - подумали разработчики. В различных ситуациях у вас будет переворачиваться текст, а иногда сменяться фон. В такие моменты просто встаешь в ступор.
Конечно же, никто вам не даст по минуте раздумывать над одним словом, ибо, как вы уже поняли, исчезает сам смысл игры. По истечению времени экран гаснет, а игра оканчивается. И, в самые последние секунды, вы должны отвечать как можно быстрее. В такие моменты игра "ловит" игрока, давая ему несколько совпадающих вариантов подряд, а после, несовпадающий. Отчаявшийся игрок, быстро выбирая, не замечает несоответствия, и проигрывает игру. Будьте внимательны.

[u]Игра получилась довольно интересной и необычной, уверен, попробывать должен(и может) каждый. Рекомендую.[/u]

---

シアンは青色ではない、と自分に言い聞かせながら遊ぶクリックゲームです。
ルールは単純明快、スクリーンに映った文字色と、その文字が合っていれば左クリック、
違っていれば右クリックをするだけのゲームです。
例）文字色：赤　文字：赤→左クリック
　　文字色：青　文字：緑→右クリック

たった、これだけです。
自分の集中力が如実に表れます。
頭でわかっていても指が勝手に間違った方を押していたり、
一瞬迷って止まっていたらいつの間にか間違っていることもよくあります。

一度遊んでみてください。きっとその一度だけで止められなくなっていますよ。

33864683.review:
OLDTV è il secondo progetto approdato su Steam del duo di Dubai riassunto dall'etichetta Creability. Precedentemente la casa aveva dato i natali a quell'Only If (2014) che personalmente ritengo uno dei titoli più incompresi e sottovalutati nella storia del videogioco indipendente, un mostro sacro nella mia memoria che difficilmente riuscirò mai a metabolizzare del tutto per scriverci due righe qua. OLDTV ha sicuramente dei confini molto più demarcati, e dispiace che il suo (meritatissimo) successo nasca dalle ceneri di un progetto interessante quale "&", cancellato dopo due anni di lavorazione e di cui potete trovare una demo su GameJolt. Tuttavia i ragazzi di Creability hanno saputo sfruttare al massimo l'eredità di &, rifinalizzando le due linee di voice acting che sentite alla fine per creare una storyline appena abbozzata, ma assai suggestiva e incisiva. OLDTV si inserisce nell'ormai consolidata traccia dell'estetica della nostalgia anni Novanta, proponendo una cornice da tubo catodico già vista altrove, come ad es. in Prompt e in You have to win this game. A differenza dei suddetti titoli però, in OLDTV il televisore non si limita a mero riferimento visivo, diventando vero e proprio sito di primitiva fascinazione e di ricerca di calore umano. Un ragazzino particolarmente sveglio riesce ad accedere a un dispositivo a raggio globale, e si avventura in un forsennato zapping che lo porta a fare il giro del mondo in ottanta click. Le definizioni che dà ai luoghi sono quelle di stereotipi infantili, di immagini e suoni tratti dal "sentito dire" che riecheggiano nella selezione dei continenti nel menu. L'alternarsi di colori e caratteri sempre più incomprensibili hanno il gusto del mistero e dell'inganno, e solo mantenendo saldi i nervi il ragazzino riesce a completare l'impresa. A schermo ormai spento, una donna lo rimprovera per essersi rinchiuso in uno sgabuzzino, e allora il ragazzino scoppia emotivamente rivolgendo al padre una domanda disperata: dov'è la sua vera madre? Malgrado la ricerca, non è riuscito a trovarla da nessuna parte. 
Questo abbozzato pretesto viene accompagnato da tracce di colonna sonora decisamente pertinente, con sonorità elettroniche ritmate spesso rimandanti a suggestioni vaporwave. Il "succo" ludico consiste in una semplice meccanica basata sul celeberrimo test di Stroop , e qui purtroppo l'impressione è che si sarebbe potuto fare qualcosa di più, magari creando, parallelamente alla modalità con stimoli randomizzati, un "hard mode" concentrato su meccaniche di priming in cui l'intelligenza artificiale è propensa a creare delle sequenze particolarmente ingannevoli dal punto di vista delle risposte cognitive. 
Chiudo ribadendo la mia ammirazione nei confronti di Creability, capaci a quanto pare anche con poche pennellate di creare un prodotto di profondità inaspettata, e resto in attesa dei loro futuri progetti (qualche piccolo teaser è già disponibile sul loro sito), che spero si potranno concretizzare con successo con questa piattaforma.

33856774.review:
Alors, OLDTV...

Pour moi, ce n'est pas un jeu , c'est un test, et franchement, il est très bon!

Ces tests ayant déjà fait parrution sur des consoles portables comme PSP et DS, on retrouve ce style de jeu sur PC mais là ou était le mode difficille sur PSP, on le retrouve ici en mode facile.

Le but du jeu est simple, on a 2 commande, clic gauche et clic droit, sur une vieille télé, des mots vont apparaître un par un, ce sont des couleurs, et la ou est le concept, c'est que lorsque la couleur du mot et la même que celle écrite, alors, clic gauche, sinon, clic droit, on ne peut plus simple.

Le gameplay :
Il est très bon, vous avez 6 couleurs dans ce jeu : Bleu, rouge, vert, jaune, violet et CYAN.
Pourquoi ai-je écrit CYAN en Majuscule, tout simplement car il va être votre pire ennemi, très ressemblant au bleu, un mauvais clic, c'est fini. On a aussi plusieurs continent, qui marche sous forme de niveaux, et plus on avance, plus la télé aura des glitchs, un exemple, le fond devient vert, et là, c'est l'horreur pour différencier bleu du CYAN.
On trouve aussi un systéme de compétences, pour avoir des bonus et tout le bordel.

L'ambiance : 
J'aime, l'un des plus gros point du jeu, en passant par les effets de lumières et la bande son qui est juste génial !

Bien maintenant, LA NOTE.

Je lui met un beau 19/20 je m'explique :

Les points forts du jeu :
-La difficulté
-L'ambiance
-La musique
-GRATUIT et sa c'est bon ! Là ou il est gratuit on devait payé 20 euros pour avoir ça sur une DS !
-Les succés, qui ont l'air d'être facile à récupérer
-Les devs ont pensés aux daltoniens et aux épileptiques, et c'est cool

Les points faibles :
-Le prix de la soundtrack, 4 euros, mais je l'ai pardonne car ils ont besoin de se faire un peu de money.
-le fait que je ne trouve pas d'autres points faibles

Conclusion :
Un bon petit jeu/test gratuit qui en fera ragé plus d'un avec sa très bonne difficulté qui rend le jeu tout de même possible.

Maintenant, les astuces !
-N'enlevaient pas les bandes horizontalles dans les paramétres, sans elles, un carnage pour différencier le bleu du CYAN.
-Par contre enlever la nausée !
-Perso je suis plus à l'aise quand je joue en anglais car lorsque les mots sont à l'envers, si on voit un Y, on pense direct à YELLOW, jaune, et aussi les mots sont plus rapides à lire.
-Dès que vous avez des PC, aller acheter directement un premier continent.
-Prener votre temps sans en abuser, surtout quand vous arriver en Europe.

La fin de cet évaluation, donc, Enjoy!


CYAN.

33838975.review:
ok... oula c'est chaud la..

donc..

ce jeu est assez unique, son concept simple consiste a faire defiler des description en couleur, le but et de faire un clic gauche lorsque la couleur correspond a la description et un clic droit lorsque ce n'est pas le cas...

simple n'est ce pas ?... seulement voila, meme sur un ecran 4K vous aurez droit a des graphismes digne d'un vieu poste tv.
 le tout chronometré et donc assez stressant...

pour combler le tout vous allez obligatoirement ( je donne ma main coupée a celui qui ne fera jamais cette erreur) vous tromper en confondant dans la précipitation le bleu et le cyan (le cyan etant bleu... mais different, l'erreur et inévitable)

un jeu avec une bonne idée, un bon concept... pas vraiment un clicker, meme si on ne fais que cliquer gauche/droite, c'est assez difficile d'aller vite. et vous allez vous tromper , encore et encore... a cause du cyan (maudit celui la -_- )

bien que simpa, ça se complique vite avec les noms a l'envers , le fond change de couleur ,etc... bref ça tourne vite au grand n'importe quoi et le jeu devient quasi impossible sans ce tromper. heureusement , inutile de faire 10 millions de coups réussi pour passer au niveau suivant.
réussir des coups vous donne des points "CP" que vous pourrez utiliser pour débloquer de nouveau continents ou des bonus pour vous aidez

je n'ai aucun probleme de vue ou d'epilepsie, mais toutefois je recommende de ne pas trop jouer a ce jeu sur de longue durée.  vous allez le ressentir vous aussi au bout d'un moment, les yeux font mal. (dur dur de ce réadapté au vieu poste tv)

je recommende ce jeu, juste parce qu'il est assez unique et peu s'averez utile pour tester vos reflex et votre vue, mais (encore une fois) je déconseille d'y jouer sur de longues sessions

6,5/10   (un temp d'adaptation et necessaire, un peu comme pour utiliser un VR. au debut, ça peu faire bizarre, tres bizarre meme)

point négatif sur le fait que l'on ne peu pas quitter le jeu proprement une fois lancer

point positif le jeu dispose d'une fonction pour personnes atteinte de daltonisme

挺不错的一款游戏，比较推荐一开始在左下角的设置里练习一下并把那些烦人的干扰去掉【比如故障，电视线条之类的】，屏幕会清楚的多。第一关比较简单，但其中青色和蓝色比较容易认错。多注意。第二关的话，字会有时候倒过来，这倒没什么。关键是会有颜色背景，混合起来比较难辨认。第三关的话。。。 。。。会有额外规则，会有反向操作和禁止换台。我完了0.5小时也就打到了这里。考的是意识流操作，读出来后靠意识判断。不过这也只是我的一种方法，不一定适合你们。希望大家也可以发觉自己的方法。
这是个不错的，创意小游戏。比较推荐，但我觉得长时间玩对神经和眼睛不太好，毕竟会高度集中。

33826151.review:
[b]¿¿POR QUÉ ME GUSTA TANTO ESTE JUEGO??[/b]

....

OLDTV es un juego con una premisa muy simple: ¿Lo que vez en la pantalla es correcto? = click izquierdo. ¿Es incorrecto? = click derecho. Tenes tiempo y eventualmente tenes condiciones como "botones invertidos", "no toques nada" y cambio de orden de las letras de lo que te dice.

La cosa aca es que tenes que tener unos reflejos de acero, porque los cambios tienen que ser al segundo.

Es simple, adictivo y entretenido. No recomendado para epilepticos. Candidato para ser el proximo Polibius.

Ah, no entendi porque todo el mundo odia el cian en este juego. Mi nemesis fue el morado y el azul.

33814247.review:
Brilliant game....like, really brilliant. 

Entirely based on the simple psychological effect called the Stroop Effect, the game attempts to interfere with your reaction times by conflating what you read with what you see, but then adds even more layers onto that as you progress. Everything in this game is designed to interfere with your decision making, including the brilliant music. Game is really stylish and the sound design is genius.

However, be warned, if for whatever reason you have a fond association with the word 'Cyan,' that is about to change.

Хотите узнать, что будет если написать слово Красный синим цветом? Так вот, тут вы и узнаете. Что нужно делать? Все просто. Пример:
Написано слово "Красный" синим цветом - ПКМ. Если надпись совпадает с цветом этой надписи, то ЛКМ. Если не совпадает - ПКМ.

33801926.review:
挺有意思的游戏，附带一些成瘾的游戏魔性，三小时全成就get√

讲下游戏的玩法，算是轻攻略吧，游戏是判断颜色检验的游戏，

游戏中附带有繁简中文，设置的方法是，主界面右下角的齿轮，

点↓箭头，第四个就是（LANGUAGE），游戏的大致玩法就是，

出现文字以及颜色，你要判断是否正确，正确就下按鼠标左键，

或者是键盘方向←键，错误就按右键或者→键，看似很简单吧，

但是到了后期会有干扰效果，建议去设置里面把，将电视线条，

恶心模式关掉，这样玩也不会产生视觉疲劳，游戏富有挑战性，

成就系统做的很合理需要一步步突破自己的水平，算蛮好玩的，

作为喜+1来说，这款免费游戏很值得玩一玩，推荐(～￣▽￣)～

33784815.review:
[h1]Cyan is blue...Cyan is not blue...Cyan is blue...CYAN IS NOT BLUE!  WHAT COLOR WAS PURPLE AGAIN?![/h1]

Warning:  Not for the epileptic, the colorblind, those with slow reaction time, or those who suffer from stress.

Welcome to [i]OLDTV[/i], formerly known as [i]V Game[/i] and more commonly by other players simply as [i]V[/i].  This is your typical Stroop test, which is a game/exercise where you confuse yourself by trying to correctly sort based on whether the word matches the color or if it doesn't while challenging your reaction time to alter your judgment.  What seems simple is a hell of a chore when pressured...and you will feel dumb for making careless mistakes...one mistake and it's all over.  Take too long and it's over.

You will argue with your brain a lot on [i]OLDTV[/i].  Your brain may forget a color or you may implusively twitch-click the wrong answer.  To further complicate matters, this game will also throw in challenges like jumbling the letters of the word, having the connection go out, reverse your controls, flip the word upside down, or even change the background color too.  Also be forewarned, that cyan is NOT blue....and blue is NOT cyan...because you WILL forget.  That's a promise.

This game offers various challenges including a colorblind mode (where you have to play under the conditions of a colorblind individual (Meaning that you play AS a handicapped person rather than the game providing a handicap if you actually are colorblind).  It also offers the option to play the game in another language, which is good for a little education and challenge.

Though this game isn't bad, I personally cannot recommend it because I didn't find it fun.  I personally found the stress a bit unbearable at times and had to put it down several times before opting for a long grind to get the achievements I wanted.  If you accept the challenge of this free game, then have at it.  But if you suffer from epilepsy, are colorblind, have a bad reaction time, or have trouble coping with stress like I do, then this casual experience is not for you.   Be warned that if you do accept the challenge, this game will make you feel dumb and your self-esteem may be lower.

4/10  A good game...but I momentarily forgot what color red was...was it cyan?

中文玩家玩这个游戏最大的困难应该就是“青”和“蓝、绿”的混淆了吧。因为汉语里，“青”代表了四五种颜色……
来来来，感受一下：“青色”“青天”“青草”“玄青布靴”。
不是学艺术或从事印刷专业的，恐怕对“青”这种颜色并不敏感，至少我这，“青”错了十四次，“蓝”和“绿”分别是十一二次，都比其他颜色错的加到一起还多。
如果其他语言不是就没有这种问题了吗？但非母语的话，本身有个思考的过程，就慢下来了，一遇到干扰项，中文的要转一个弯，别的语言要转两个弯，还很容易转不过来，哪怕是最熟悉的英文也是这样。
至于日语里的汉字倒是和中文的汉字差不多，但是更坑，因为它里面的“青"指的是蓝色……

33762792.review:
[h1] Minimalistic, Spectacular Masterpiece. [/h1]

The mechanics are pretty simple. You see a word on each successive channel, and then you decide whether the color matches the word. Seems easy and dull, huh? Well, you'll find yourself stuggling so bad while playing this game, though. There are many effects which interfere you by distorting the screen. Besides, the cheeky tricks like 'Don't Switch' or 'Inverted Control' make your gameplay really hard to do. You have to think fast in a second.

The game itself is brilliant and addictive as hell. The soundtracks are so gorgeous, I couldn't resist myself from searching for those(Now they released the soundtrack, so I'm satisfied right now). Most of all, it's free to play now. I'd gotta say this one is the must-play game.

However, please be advised that it's not for those prone to photosensitive epilepsy. You've been warned.

33757514.review:
Allow me to go on a rave about this game and how its incredibly simple concept is more enjoyable than it should be. This is a mind game where you're given a colored word and given a few seconds decide whether the word is or isn't describing its own color. It's simple as can be and seems like it'd get boring after the first few times, but the game throws more and more mechanics as you go on. There's a progression system in place where you're travelling through every country in the world and after a correct answer you go to another country; answer a certain number of colors correctly you'll move onto the next level, another continent. Visually the game imitates a CRT as you're travelling the world through your television and alongside this is a chill soundtrack that changes for every continent spicing up the game along the way.

Along the way you'll be earning points for every few correct answers and be able to purchase skips, 2x the points, or a second chance. You can also rack up a combo if you answer quickly, the combo system gives you both points and a way to see how well you're doing. As you move on from continent to continent the game will start throwing new mechanics at you such as reversing your input or removing it completely! There are also visual effects that may happen such as flipping the screen or fuzzing it out. These change ups keep the game from becoming too repetitive or easy since you'll have to stop and think about what's going on.

Overall it's a nervewracking adventure around the world that will make you constantly question your decisions and sanity as you forget basic colors because of the risk of losing it all (unless you bought another life). It's a fantastic experience that's great for playing solo or making fun of your friends. It has achievements and is also free! It's easy to understand and well worth taking a glance at.

TL;DR: It's brutal and will make you question if you really learned anything in kindergarten.

33736749.review:
테레비죤과 여섯 색깔을 통해 떠나는 세계일주.

옛날 TV 화면을 배경으로 오세아니아부터 아프리카까지 지구촌의 모든 나라를 돌아다니는 세계 일주 게임이다. 뭐 세계일주래봐야 그냥 각 나라 이름 순서대로 뜨는 것 밖에 없긴 하지만, 90년대 테레비죤 화면을 재현해낸 게임 화면은 나름 인상적이다. 옛날 생각도 살짝 나고 말이다.

게임을 시작하면 특정한 색깔을 띈 글자가 차례대로 출력된다. 출력된 글자와 실제 글자의 색상이 맞는지 틀린지를 판별하는 지극히 간단한 게임이다. 물론 제한 시간도 존재하고 중반 이후에는 온갖 방식의 방해도 등장한다. 쉬울 것 같지만, 온갖 방해도 있고 인간의 반응이란 게 한계가 있다보니 생각보다 자주 실수하게 된다. 게임을 진행하며 획득한 CP를 바탕으로 좀 더 나중 지점에서 시작하거나 특정 스킬들을 구매할 수 있고, 일종의 무한 모드인 '우주 모드'를 해금할 수도 있다.

빠르게 답을 맞춰나가면 최대 3단계까지 콤보가 쌓이며, 이 상태에서 각 문제를 0.6초 이내에 4개를 연속으로 맞추면 '셜록 모드'가 등장한다. 막 클릭해도 진행이 되는 일종의 부스트 모드 같은건데, 보너스 성으로 넣어둔 모드같지만 게임을 클리어할 때나 프리퀀시 도전과제 깰 때 꽤나 요긴하게 쓰인다. 각 채널마다 초반에 셜록 모드만 켜두면 이후 진행이 상당히 편해지니 말이다. 물론 그만큼 반응속도가 상당히 중요하고, 우주 모드에선 발동이 안 된다.

대단히 혜자롭고 재미진 무료 게임. 혹시나 게임 재미있게 즐겼다면 스팀을 통해 도네이션이 가능하니 단 돈 천원이라도 도네이션 정도는 해주는 예의를 보이도록 하자.

P.S!  그나저나 도대체 왜 파란색과 시안색(하늘색)을 왜 따로 둔건진 도무지 모르겠다.

33731882.review:
This may be one of the most well realized games I've ever played.
The concept is the simplest concept. Left click if the colour matches the word, right click if it doesn't.
This turns out to be sort of like how Osu! and Super Hexagon are for your hands, but for your brain.

First off there are two ways to play, and this might be the most ingenious part of it all.
First, you can play slowly and steadily. Take a moment to think here and there and you'll eventually run down all of the puzzles in an area.
Or you can play fast and loose, which requires you to basically anticipate the next colour on the screen and react in a fraction of a second.

The fact that the game allows both ways to play makes it better balanced than most AAA games. 
Also all of the achievements are not only wacky, but fun as well.

Playing the game in a different language, or in monochrome mode, actually introduce you to new ways to have fun with the game when you feel like you've run out. Not to mention attempting to figure out the legendary achievements.

This is offically my new go to game when I'm just looking to burn a couple of minutes. And I don't see another game toppling it ever.

One of the most deviously simple games I have ever played, I envision this game being mandatory to play in some dark 1984esque dystopia.

All you have to do is left click for yes and right click for no, unless of course it’s telling you not to click, or the controls are reversed.

33712004.review:
This game is incredible! Seriously, though. It totally went above and beyond my expectations.
[b] Gameplay [/b]
It is quite simple, you click left if the word matches the color, and right if the word does not match the color. As the levels go on, more complexeties are thrown your way to make it more challenging.
What I love about this game is the progression. It never feels like its getting old. There are a lot of gameplay elements, with skills, level areas, varying obstacles. And it's just fun and addictive. 
There are achievements, quite a few, that I still need to get. So I will be playing this game a lot. Oh and there are modes too, and secret levels. 

[b] Music and Sound [/b]
Incredible. Absolutely amazing music. It's like Lo-Fi Triphop beats and it's my favorite kind of music, so I loved hearing it throughout the game. One thing it does brilliantly is sound design. The sounds are super unique, and there are some many nuances to the sound of this game. When you hover over things and such. It sounds great.

[b] Visuals [/b]
The old CRT / Neo-VHS aesthetic is great. All the settings are customizable as well, with different pallates (color blind modes) and scan lines, etc. Everything is snappy, jumpy, and elegant. It is very unique and fun to look at. 

[b] Over-all [/b]
For a free game it is fantastic. A must-play, at least once. It doesn't hurt to try. And the developers are updating the game and are super nice, so I want to support them and you should too. 

It's really well made and a blast to look at, play and listen to. [b] TRY IT [/b]
9.5/10

33707566.review:
对于这款游戏，如果是休闲玩家，不要太过于认真和沉迷，因为有时候你会被你的自己的”猪脑子“活活气死。

如果对这个游戏画面感受到不适的话，我建议把设置里面的”电视线“和”恶心“关掉，不然真的很影响游戏的体验（关掉之后反而舒爽了许多）。

说一些游戏的设定，玩家是可以在开头询问界面更换语言文字的，然后按Y进入游戏，如果要退出游戏，要在主菜单界面长按ESC关闭，是不是有一种小时候关电视机的感觉？游戏里面的频道是可以更换的，有点像更换难度一样（欢迎补充细节）。

我十分推荐“Americas”频道的音乐，就是这个商店界面预告片的音乐，十分好听，以及“Aisa”频道。

再来说一下游戏里面我常犯的错误，紫色，青色，蓝色，这三种颜色，只要我开了“电视线”，或者背景色突然换的是这个颜色的反色，我一紧张，就很难把这三个颜色区分（不知道其他人有没有和我一样的情况。

总体来说这个游戏我不是很讨厌，也不是很喜欢，但游戏的风格让我眼前一亮，我还没怎么见到过这么魔性的游戏hhhh。

33702859.review:
I have got to give it to this game... it blew my mind. From the mesmerizing colours ( not good if you're epileptic though, watch out!) to the AMAZING soundtrack. Wait no, that's an understatement. AMAZING OUTSTANDING INCREDIBLE AWESOME REMARKABLE ASTONISHING, i would say. By the way, if you're new to this game, it might be hard figuring out what to do. Plus, there are practically NO videos or tutorials of V on YouTube. So for all those people, I will grant them the godly gift of explanation. Names of colours are flashed in front of you. They are written in a certain colour. If the colour of the writing is the same as the actual word, left-click. If the colours of the font and the word don't match, right-click. For the rest, I'll let you guys discover it ;).


   I also admire how well the creators of this game settled in the community. Their game is free, and they really let the players have a say in how the game is made. It's easy to communicate, and that's why I also want to congratulate the devs. Plus, they have very frequent updates that make this game even more worthwhile.

  It's a nice game to play when you're bored all other games, or something to wake up your senses a little. And before you tell me : but you've barely played anything how can you judge?". I can judge, trust me. That's how good this game is.

Good job Devs!

33693346.review:
V. Was für ein spannender und erfindungsreicher Titel. Bloss heist das Spiel OLDTV. Ist es nicht toll wenn man das Spiel durchspielen muss, nur um am Ende den eigentlichen Namen des Spieles zu erfahren? Stellt euch mal vor ihr kauft euch ein Spiel namens O. Nachdem ersten Kapitel würdet ihr dann ein LO sehen im Startbildschirm. In der Mitte des Spieles dann ein ALO und der endgültige Titel wäre nachdem man geflüchtet ist HALO. Klingt gut gebe ich zu.

Tatsache ist, es ist ein Spiel,  gemacht für Menschen die wirklich ihre Konzentrationsfähigkeit, Reaktionsgeschwindigkeit und Ihre eigene Frustrations Grenze testen wollen. Das Spiel:

Am Anfang hat man kein Plan was man machen soll. Oder wie man es spielen soll. Denn das Tutorial ist genialer weise im Optionsmenü gespeichert. Man kommt aber nicht Anfangs darauf weil man versehentlich die Maus anklickt und plötzlich, huch, schreit einem der Bildschirm BLAU ins Gesicht. Okay was will er von mir? Soll ich ihm nachsprechen? Es malen? Es eintippen? Also klicke ich einfach mal die Linke Maustaste und plötzlich bin ich wieder im Hauptmenü. Was ist das? Also ich klcike nochmal an und werde nach Ozeanien verbunden...warum? Mit welchem Hintergrund? Der Bildschirm schreit mir Rot ins Gesicht. Ich drücke mal nochmal und dann schreit er mir Cyan ins Gesicht.

Das Gameplay läuft wie folgt: Wenn man Rot sieht muss man bestätigen ob der Text Rot ist indem man die Linke Maustast drückt. Ist der Text aber Gelb obwohl das Wort Rot steht muss man dem Computer wiedersprechen indem man die Rechte Maustaste drückt. Das ist das Ganze Spiel. Errinert mich irgendwie an einen Computertest im Karrierecenter. Das schlimme jedoch ist das es mit steigender Zahl schwieriger wird. Plötzlich ist der gesamte Bildschirm grün, der Text steht auf dem Kopf, der Stricher will das ich Falsch Antworten soll (das war immer der Genickbrecher für mich) oder das ich erst gar nicht antworten soll. Dann muss ich noch mehrmals mit der Mausklicken weil ich das Sigal verloren habe (natürlich verliert man das Signal wenn man sich Sender in Afrika anschauen will.) Es ist SEHR herausfordernd und anstrengend.

Spieler sind der Meinung das der Soundtrack Genial ist. Wirklich? Dark Souls der Soundtrack war gut. Shadow of the Collosus der Soudntrack war ein Meisterwerk gewesen. Riot kann einen anehmbaren Soundtrack vorweisen (besonders Frejlord Theme). Aber dieser Soundtrack stammt von einem ADHS erkranktem Kind das unfähig ist sich auf eine Sache zu konzentrieren. Es klingt scheußlich und ich glaube das soll es auch sein.

Die Entwickler wollten keinen Soundtrack komponieren der dem Spieler gefällt sondern der ihn massivst ablenkt und seine Konzentrationsfähigkeit belastet. Das Spiel wird um einiges einfacher wenn man den Sound auf Stumm schaltet.
Ziel des Spieles ist es sämtliche Länder und alle Kontinente der Welt durchzuzappen. Warum jedoch Afrika so wichtig ist, ist mir ein Rätsel. Wer alle Achievments für dieses Spiel bekommt, zeigt das er defintiv zu schlau ist und er wahrscheinlcih Progamer ist der auch an Internationalen Turnieren teil nimmt.

Glücklicherweise gibt es eine Art Savefunktion so das es möglich ist das Spiel zu beenden (man muss nämlich den Kontinent freischalten und von dort aus starten.)

Tatsache ist: Es ist ein gelungenes Spiel. Es mal was anderes, es fördert die Konzentrationsstärke, schult das Gehirn, verursacht bei manchen Personen Craniale Beschwerden mit anschließenden neurologischen Anfällen und es ist ein netter Zeitvertreib. Bloss sollte die Person die dieses Spiel spielt auch wirklich Konzentriert sein.

33691804.review: I downloaded this game and completed it all in one night, and strangely, regardless of the lack of content, it draws me back to it with simple gameplay, minimalistic style, impressive sound design, and an addictive element of challenge. Each new level brings unique challeges and changes to the gameplay, which constantly forces your brain to strike a balance between visceral reaction time and keen judgement. Even after the initial few hours in which you've completed the "campaign," there are several difficult achievements to work towards, which require diligance, and plenty of practice. The game provides an intuitive challege for both raw reaction time, while also stimulating active thought, and preventing the brain from going into auto-pilot. This game is very fun for 4 a.m. when you run out of things to do, and it will also suprise you with intelligent, polished, and addictive gameplay. 10/10.

V, é um jogo muito simples, assim como o nome! Porém, desafiador e viciante ao mesmo tempo. O seu principal objetivo é completar todos os países de todos os continentes conforme a escrita e a cor que lhe aparece na tela. Se a escrita for pertinente a cor você aperta o botão esquerdo do mouse, e vice-versa!
A trilha sonora do jogo é algo que te faz concentrar ainda mais no seu objetivo e é exelente. 
O jogo pode ser zerado dentro de uma hora, e suas missões completadas dentro de 2 ou 3 horas de jogo. E o melhor: é gratuito!

______________________________________________________________________________


V, it's a very simple game, just like the name! But challenging and addictive at the same time. Its main goal is to complete all countries on all continents according to the writing and the color that appears on the screen. If writing is pertinent to color you press the left mouse button, and vice versa!
The soundtrack of the game is something that makes you focus even more on your goal and is excellent.
The game can be reset within one hour, and your quests completed within 2 or 3 hours of play. And the best: it's free!

OLD T(V) is a gamified version of the stroop test with some twists in the later game. 
The main task is to verify if the shown colour does or does not match with the shown word simply by pressing LMB or RMB for Yes or No.
Your reactions, focus and concentration will be guiding you through the whole experience, supported by a really good soundtrack and beautiful art design.

Awesome, challenging and positive mind-boggling game you´ll get here for the fact that it costs nothing. The Devs give you the option to donate if you really want to support them. That is a damn fine way to introduce your company and your game to Steam and the Community. Updates happen frequently and the Developers are really active and communicative towards the community.

Keep up the good work, Devs! Looking forward what you´re going to develop in the future!

33668483.review:
In essence, V is a gamified version of the Stroop test. A simple task coated with progression mechanics and an interesting aesthetic motivates to challenge one's own reaction time.

Visually, the distortions and flickers of the simulated VGA TV screen are very well done and don't turn out to be disrupting the attentiveness. Surprisingly, the player is required to focus so much that the effects are mentally put into a blind spot and thus, at least in my case, don't cause nausea. Nevertheless, options to reduce the effects of some interferences and different colour-blind modes are available.

The music is dope but, depending on preference, maybe a little too boisterous compared to the activity it accompanies. Together with the driving beats, popping visuals and clean sound effects, V pressures the player to concentrate hard. After unlocking additional continents and playing these, new prompts that introduce alternative rules appear and intensify the synapse activity. One or two hours at a time are doable before attention slowly drifts away and mistakes become more frequent. Frustration over one's own stupidity sets in and brute force doesn't help, so taking a break every little while is vital.

V is a glorified reaction test with nice trappings.

This game [i]needs[/i] FPS-limiting options. I'm getting 2800 FPS, which means my graphics card is rendering 2740 FPS more than it needs to.

Without an FPS-cap your graphics card will churn out as many frames as possible, which means your graphics card will be running at 100% all the time; completely unnecessary. Even trying to force vSync on with NVIDIA Control Panel doesn't work.

I'm looking at GPU-Z, and these values are what I would expect from a synthetic stress-test. The latest games on maximum settings don't push my graphics card this hard.

This might be a good game; I don't know. I'll play the game again when it's fixed.

33650703.review:
Basically, this game shows you a series of color names (eg blue, red, purple, etc) and has you left click if the color of the text matches the word that is written, and right click if it doesn't (eg. if it says blue and it's written in blue font you left click, but if it says blue and it's written with red font then you right click).

The trouble is that two of the colors are blue and cyan and, at least to English speakers, cyan is a shade of blue. So half of my mistakes have been left clicking when it says blue but it's written in cyan. It is incredibly frustrating.

[strike]Also, the game is a real pain to play on a Mac because the trackpad has no physical buttons, so to right click you have to press down with two fingers. It doesn't always register the two fingers properly, so I lose even when I'm right. I really wish there was an option to play with the keyboard, like with the left and right arrow keys or something.[/strike]

Edit: The developers listen to feedback and have added the option to play with the keyboard, so that is good of them. However I still can't play the game without getting frustrated because of the blue/cyan thing.
